definition: abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
Anti-Rightist Movement, Mao's purge of "rightists" after the Hundred Flowers Campaign ended in 1957
war of 1915 against Yuan Shikai and for the Republic

sentences.english: I've spent my entire adult life doing battle with this idea.
sentences.chinese: 整个成年生活我都在和这个想法作斗争。

sentences.english: After that the struggle inside the party grew more acute.
sentences.chinese: 在那以后，党内的斗争变得更加尖锐。

sentences.english: Do with their death bury their parents' strife.
sentences.chinese: 著实以两人的死埋葬双方父母的斗争。

sentences.english: The liberals prefer to sit on the fence while the other parties fight it out.
sentences.chinese: 自由党宁可抱骑墙态度，坐待其他党派去斗争到底。

sentences.english: They took the form of armed struggle.
sentences.chinese: 她们采取了武装斗争的形式。

sentences.english: Luring [A7] students back from foreign campuses constitutes China's new class struggle[A8] .
sentences.chinese: 因此，吸引海外学生归囯成为了中囯新的阶级斗争。

sentences.english: When the fight begins within himself, a man's worth something. ---( R.
sentences.chinese: 当一个人内心开始斗争时，他就有了价值。

sentences.english: A struggle has been started against the tendency towards new warlordism in the Eighth Route Army .
sentences.chinese: 在八路军中，开始向新军阀主义倾向作斗争。

sentences.english: It also struggled, until recently, with quality challenges.
sentences.chinese: 直到最近它还与质量挑战作斗争。

sentences.english: It fights obesity, diabetes, and heart disease all day.
sentences.chinese: 早餐整天都与肥胖症，糖尿病，心脏病做斗争。

sentences.english: They were fighting for freedom of speech and freedom of assembly.
sentences.chinese: 他们在为言论自由和集会自由而斗争。

sentences.english: They turned down or gave up comfort and wealth in order to fight for what is right.
sentences.chinese: 他们拒绝或放弃安逸与富有，为正义而斗争。

sentences.english: But a definitive decision on the form of struggle to be pursued had not yet been made.
sentences.chinese: 但是对于所从事的斗争的明确方式还没有作出规定。
他们进行了拼死的斗争。

sentences.english: Struggle through the thought, he still turns around come home.
sentences.chinese: 经过思想斗争，他还是掉头回家。

sentences.english: But it is also an existential struggle.
sentences.chinese: 但这也是一场生存斗争。

definition: to resist/to make a stand and fight (against)
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
internal strife/power struggle/(of members of an organization) to fight each other
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
